heading: Introducing Vue 3 Composition API
description: The Composition API in Vue 3 introduces a new way to organize and reuse logic across components, helping with code organization and scalability for large applications.

heading: Understanding Tailwind Utility Classes
description: Tailwind CSS uses a utility-first approach, meaning each class performs a specific task. This results in faster styling, less CSS bloat, and easier maintenance over time.

heading: Building Reusable Components
description: Reusable components allow you to build modular UIs that are consistent and easy to maintain. Proper use of props and slots can greatly enhance flexibility.

heading: Routing with Vue Router
description: Vue Router helps in creating single-page applications by mapping routes to components, managing navigation guards, and handling dynamic segments efficiently.

heading: State Management with Pinia
description: Pinia is the official state management solution for Vue 3, offering a simpler and more intuitive API than Vuex while being fully TypeScript compatible.

heading: Improving Accessibility in Vue Apps
description: Ensuring your app is accessible means supporting keyboard navigation, screen readers, and proper color contrast — improving usability for all users.

heading: Performance Optimizations for Vue
description: To optimize Vue performance, consider lazy loading, component-level caching, and code-splitting to improve initial load and interactivity time.

heading: Deploying with Vite
description: Vite offers lightning-fast development and optimized production builds. Deploy your Vue 3 app seamlessly to Netlify, Vercel, or your preferred host.

heading: Vue Transitions and Animations
description: Vue provides built-in transition components for animating elements as they enter or leave the DOM, enhancing user experience with smooth visual feedback.

heading: Managing Forms in Vue
description: Handling forms in Vue is straightforward with v-model, but validation and state management can be streamlined using libraries like VeeValidate.

heading: Dark Mode with Tailwind CSS
description: Tailwind CSS supports dark mode using class strategies. Customize themes dynamically to provide a better user experience and accessibility.

heading: Deploying a Vue App to GitHub Pages
description: GitHub Pages allows you to host static websites for free. Use the `vite-plugin-pages` or GitHub Actions to automate deployment of your Vue app.

heading: Integrating APIs with Axios
description: Axios is a promise-based HTTP client used to fetch data from APIs. Handle errors gracefully and store responses in a state management system like Pinia.

heading: Vue 3 Lifecycle Hooks
description: Lifecycle hooks like `onMounted`, `onUpdated`, and `onUnmounted` allow you to tap into the component's lifecycle and execute logic at key points.

heading: Creating Custom Directives in Vue
description: Custom directives extend Vue’s template syntax and can be used for things like detecting clicks outside elements or applying tooltips dynamically.

heading: Pagination in Vue Apps
description: Pagination is essential for handling large datasets. Combine API support with UI logic to deliver fast and responsive navigation through pages.

heading: Building a Blog with Vue and Markdown
description: You can build static blogs using Vue and Markdown parsing libraries like `marked`, combining dynamic Vue components with content from `.md` files.

heading: Authentication with Firebase in Vue
description: Firebase Authentication offers a quick way to add login/signup flows to your Vue app. Combine it with route guards to protect pages and fetch user data.

heading: Using Composition API vs Options API
description: The Composition API offers better code organization for complex components, while the Options API is easier for newcomers. Choose what fits your team.

heading: Integrating Vue with Tailwind Plugins
description: Tailwind plugins like `forms`, `typography`, and `aspect-ratio` can be added to enhance your styles, especially for form elements and content-rich pages.
